results.title: Islands in the stream
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Max Palewsky, Peter Bart and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: Abridged version of Hemingway’s novel. An artist living alone on his island retreat is visited by his sons. Over the summer, he discovers their mutual need and respect. (This section, however, is not representative of the theme of the novel as a whole). Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Love carefully
results.brief_description: A straightforward film aimed at the undereducated adult - 8th (US) grade or below, slow learners or foreign-born residents with difficulties in English. Presents the rhythm method, the Pill, withdrawal, condoms, foam, the diaphragm, the IUD, abortion and sterilisation.

results.title: Human growth. - 3rd ed.
results.brief_description:
Compares the physical and sexual development of boys and girls from birth through adolescence. Discusses attitudes towards growing up and having a family.
Suitable for upper primary, lower secondary and teacher levels.

results.title: The Psychic parrot
results.brief_description: A psychic parrot appears on television to announce that the world will end at midnight Friday. The President decides to send a rocket to the moon with a selected group of people on board so that the human race will survive. The build-up and drama in the days preceding the final events are dutifully reported by television and received by Henrietta (Alix Elias) and Fred (Michael Vale), stereotyped apartment dwellers who formulate their judgements while they experience life through television’s perceptual filter.

results.title: Footscray 1911
results.brief_description: Scenes of Footscray around 1911. Shows street scenes, transport, recreation and clothing. Recognizable scenes include Nicholson Street and Forges Store. Footscray Railway Station and Federal Hall.

results.title: The Miami experiment
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An American defence lawyer argues that his 15 year-old client is not guilty of murder. The plea is insanity, caused by exposure to television violence. The trial is the first major trial to be televised live during the proceedings. The case for and against this radical experiment is examined. A landmark use of television cameras inside a courtroom…an interesting overview and outcome from 1976. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Life and death of Steve Biko
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Clarke, Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Biko was the founder of the black people’s convention in South Africa which was working towards the abolition of apartheid. After his death in September 1977 whilst in legal custody, his widow and movement leaders claimed he was murdered by the police. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Clarke, Michael Ryan and Granada Television International

results.title: A Touch of the terminals
results.creator_credit: Philip Bull and Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch
results.brief_description: Its the machine age, computers are taking over - reducing the workforce and increasing productivity. The unemployed can’t afford to buy the products produced and therefore the company can’t sell its products and is losing money. To make money they cull more workers, bring in more machines and again more unemployed who can’t afford to buy. A satirical look at the effects of computers. Cast includes Martin Vaughan, Michael Ross, Ray Anderson, Tony Llewellyn-Jones.

To make money they cull more workers, bring in more machines and again more unemployed who can’t afford to buy. A satirical look at the effects of computers. Cast includes Martin Vaughan, Michael Ross, Ray Anderson, Tony Llewellyn-Jones.
